headline: EVgo Autocharge+ Surpasses 5 Million Sessions and Sixfold Enrollment Growth, Delivering Seamless EV Charging Nationwide

headline: Uber Launches Robotaxi Service In Dallas With Waymo Rival
summary: Uber Technologies is launching autonomous rides in partnership with Avride in Dallas, the first official launch for a partnership the companies announced last year.  Uber stock pushed higher in early Wednesday trading.  The service is available in nine square miles of Dallas' downtown and will initially include an "on-board specialist" monitoring the vehicles, according to Uber's announcement.

content.title: Uber Launches Robotaxi Service In Dallas With Waymo Rival
content.summary: Uber Technologies is launching autonomous rides in partnership with Avride in Dallas, the first official launch for a partnership the companies announced last year.  Uber stock pushed higher in early Wednesday trading.  The service is available in nine square miles of Dallas' downtown and will initially include an "on-board specialist" monitoring the vehicles, according to Uber's announcement.

headline: Latest News In Electric Vehicles - Tesla's European Decline as Chinese Brands Rise
summary: Tesla, once a beacon of innovation in the electric vehicle market, is reportedly experiencing a decline in brand appeal among new-car buyers in Europe according to a study by Escalent, Inc. The report indicates that Tesla is losing its edge in design and quality, leading to its perception as a more mainstream brand rather than premium. In contrast, Chinese automotive brands are gaining traction in the market, with increased consumer consideration and trustworthiness. These developments...

headline: Tesla Chinese Sales Were Good. Why the Stock Is Stalling.
summary: Tesla  stock has had a quiet start to December, despite solid sales data out of China.  Shares of the electric vehicle maker were up 0.1% in premarket trading at $429.79, while  and  futures were up 0.1%.  Shares dropped 0.2% on Tuesday after industry data providers disclosed Tesla’s wholesale sales data in China.

headline: Autolane Secures $7.4M in Funding, Launches Curbside Operating System at Simon® Centers to Transform Retail Curbs for Autonomous Vehicle Era
summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., December 03, 2025--Autolane, a leader in autonomous vehicle infrastructure, today announced $7.4 million in funding co-led by Draper Associates and Hyperplane, with participation from LAUNCH and Feld Ventures. Additionally, Autolane is deploying its curbside operating system at four Simon® properties in Texas and California.

content.title: Autolane Secures $7.4M in Funding, Launches Curbside Operating System at Simon® Centers to Transform Retail Curbs for Autonomous Vehicle Era
content.summary: PALO ALTO, Calif., December 03, 2025--Autolane, a leader in autonomous vehicle infrastructure, today announced $7.4 million in funding co-led by Draper Associates and Hyperplane, with participation from LAUNCH and Feld Ventures. Additionally, Autolane is deploying its curbside operating system at four Simon® properties in Texas and California.

headline: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
summary: Northern Sun Energy announces its expansion into the Midwest with the construction of its first Illinois project, a 7.5 MWp fixed tilt solar array paired with 1,050 kVA of battery storage designed to directly power Prysmian's cable manufacturing plant in Du Quoin, Illinois. The facility, which produces copper medium voltage cable which can be used in renewable energy applications like solar or wind, will draw clean energy from the new system, reducing reliance on the grid and accelerating its tr

content.title: Northern Sun Energy and PowerFlex Announce Solar + Storage Behind-the-Meter Project for Prysmian Manufacturing
content.summary: Northern Sun Energy announces its expansion into the Midwest with the construction of its first Illinois project, a 7.5 MWp fixed tilt solar array paired with 1,050 kVA of battery storage designed to directly power Prysmian's cable manufacturing plant in Du Quoin, Illinois. The facility, which produces copper medium voltage cable which can be used in renewable energy applications like solar or wind, will draw clean energy from the new system, reducing reliance on the grid and accelerating its tr

headline: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.

content.title: SEC Halts High-Leveraged ETF Plans in Warning Over Risks
content.summary: In a set of nine almost identical letters posted Tuesday, the SEC told firms including Direxion, ProShares and Tidal that it would not move forward with reviewing proposed launches until key issues are addressed.  At the heart of the regulator’s concern is that the funds’ risk exposures may exceed SEC limits on how much risk a fund can take on relative to its assets.  The letters direct the fund managers to either revise their investment strategies or formally withdraw their applications.
